meanings.definition: A unit of weight equal to about 1.33 pounds.
meanings.sent1: She bought two catties of apples at the market.
meanings.sent2: The recipe called for three catties of flour.
meanings.sent3: The catties of sugar in the pantry seemed to whisper 'bake a cake.'
meanings.sent4: Her love for baking weighed more than any catties on a scale.
meanings.sent5: The catties of rice spilled out of the torn bag, creating a snowy mess.

meanings.definition: A plural form of the word 'catty', meaning sly or spiteful.
meanings.sent1: The group of girls exchanged catties glances during the meeting.
meanings.sent2: Their catties remarks revealed their true feelings.
meanings.sent3: The catties whispers in the hallway made her suspect a prank.
meanings.sent4: His smile was as sharp and sly as a pack of catties.
meanings.sent5: The catties behavior of the cat made it clear it was up to mischief.
